title: End of World War II
summary: Japan signs the instrument of surrender aboard USS Missouri, ending WWII.
description: The surrender ceremony took place aboard the USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay on September 2, 1945, marking the end of the deadliest conflict in human history. Over 70 million people perished during the six-year war.

title: United Nations Founded
summary: The United Nations officially comes into existence.
description: The UN Charter was ratified by the five permanent members of the Security Council—China, France, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, and the United States—and a majority of other signatories.

title: Truman Doctrine — Cold War Begins
summary: President Truman pledges to contain Soviet expansion, marking the dawn of the Cold War.
description: The Truman Doctrine established that the United States would provide political, military, and economic assistance to all democratic nations under threat from external or internal authoritarian forces. This policy defined American foreign policy for the next four decades.

title: Marshall Plan Announced
summary: Secretary of State George Marshall outlines the European Recovery Program.
description: The Marshall Plan provided over $13 billion in economic assistance to help rebuild Western European economies after WWII. It was instrumental in preventing the spread of communism in Europe.

title: NATO Established
summary: The North Atlantic Treaty Organization is formed by 12 founding nations.
description: NATO was established as a collective defense alliance, with the principle that an armed attack against one member is considered an attack against all.

title: People's Republic of China Proclaimed
summary: Mao Zedong proclaims the People's Republic of China in Tiananmen Square.

title: Korean War Begins
summary: North Korean forces invade South Korea, beginning a three-year conflict.
